meanings.sent1: She spoke exaggeratedly, making her story sound more exciting than it really was.
meanings.sent2: He always laughs exaggeratedly at jokes, even the ones that aren't that funny.
meanings.sent3: The little boy exaggeratedly pretended to be a superhero, wearing a cape made from a towel.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was so exaggeratedly bright that it lit up the entire room.
meanings.sent5: The actor exaggeratedly stumbled across the stage, pretending to be a clumsy waiter.

meanings.sent1: She tends to exaggeratedly boast about her accomplishments to impress others.
meanings.sent2: Politicians often exaggeratedly promise things they cannot deliver to gain votes.
meanings.sent3: The chef exaggeratedly claimed his soup was the best in the world, but it was just average.
meanings.sent4: His excuses for being late were so exaggeratedly elaborate that no one believed him.
meanings.sent5: The author exaggeratedly described the storm as a raging beast, adding drama to the story.

meanings.definition: To enlarge or increase beyond normal bounds
meanings.sent1: The artist exaggeratedly enlarged the eyes of the portrait to create a unique style.
meanings.sent2: The company exaggeratedly expanded its operations, opening multiple new branches in a year.
meanings.sent3: The baker exaggeratedly increased the size of the cupcakes, making them too big to fit in the box.
meanings.sent4: The rumor about the celebrity's secret wedding exaggeratedly grew into a full-blown scandal.
meanings.sent5: The garden gnome was exaggeratedly enlarged to be the centerpiece of the garden.
